Package xxl.core.cursors.identities

The package xxl.core.cursors.identities provides miscellaneous implementations of identity operators on cursors.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
TeeCursor.StorageArea<E> This interface is used to store the objects delivered by the iteration specified in a tee-cursor's constructor and to return them, if the method cursor of the class implementing this interface is called.
 

Class Summary
DelayCursor This class holds the values of the underlying input iteration for a certain amount of time before returning the object.
LoggingMetaDataCursor This class decorates a cursor or a metadata-cursor passing by all its method calls while writing logging information to a print-stream.
NotUpdatableCursor<O,I extends O> This class provides a decorator for a given iteration that prevents updates on the underlying cursor.
TeeCursor<E> A tee-cursor provides a method to duplicate a given iteration.
TeeCursor.FileStorageArea<E> A TeeCursor.StorageArea that stores elemenst in a file.
TeeCursor.ListStorageArea<E> A TeeCursor.StorageArea that stores elemenst in a list.
TeeCursor.QueueStorageArea<E> A TeeCursor.StorageArea that stores elemenst in a queue.
ThreadedIterator This class provides a wrapper for iterations to let them run in a new thread.
UnmodifiableCursor<E> This class provides a decorator for a given iteration that cannot be modified.
 

Package xxl.core.cursors.identities Description

The package xxl.core.cursors.identities provides miscellaneous implementations of identity operators on cursors. These operators can have different tasks (like duplicating an input iteration, etc.) but they all have in common that the elements delivered by the input iteration are returned without being changed by them.
